sense.name: throw or discard by throwing
sense.examples: Why should I have pitched the Hershey account? Jamie pitched the bone onto the street, to draw out the dog pack. The best hope she had was that Wess had pitched the pager ino the New River. Could you pitch this 3-day-old newspaper? Sumiko was pitched into the battle. I'd pitch myself off the Astronomy Tower if I had to continue for another two years. If you don't hurry, you'll be pitched into the fire.

sense.name: move abruptly; fall; run into
sense.examples: The boat pitched down one wave and through the next. Within a minute, the plane pitched drastically to the right. She pitched over the railing of the balcony.

sense.name: set a musical tone
sense.examples: Marty pitched his voice very low. Anna pitched her voice two octaves higher, giving the song a crisp quality.

sense.name: advertise strongly in positive terms
sense.examples: I pitched an idea for a nonprofit that was rebuilding burned churches with volunteer support. He pitched the three ideas to the Pittsburgh Pirates.

sense.name: be at an angle; lean
sense.commentary: NOTE: no motion is implied in this sense.
sense.examples: The terrain pitched up from the forest floor, becoming a tangled slope of moss-covered boulders. In the area where the ceiling pitched we built a shelf.

sense.name: BASEBALL: throw from the mound to the batter
sense.examples: Maine pitched the game of his young life with the Mets' season hanging in the balance. Hernandez pitched the final two innings.

sense.name: GOLF: hit in a high arc with a backspin
help out; cooperate
sense.examples: Vail pitched in to bring New York's Philharmonic Orchestra to the music festival. Everyone pitched in to buy Sam his retirement gift. After the hurricane, the whole community pitched in to rebuild the town.

sense.name: CARDS: lead and establish a trump suit
